hints.content:
Every coin has a different value.

Coin name | Picture | Value
- | - | -
Penny | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/d0799f515398b1f48cb0baa7bdc8d0c12e26c70c.png) | $1¢$
Nickel | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/f6c7ae82228012be92b624995809aeabc8e95370.png) | $5¢$
Dime | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/2017369b968caa0c88d046bddf2406665c8cd34d.png) | $10¢$
Quarter | ![](https://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-images/1cc5cb6f4c779c49984f5a63a58443ce0ca96ff9.png) | $25¢$

Let's label the value of each set of coins and find the total.

###$5$ nickels and $1$ penny

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢} +\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{5}{\text{ nickels}}} +\underbrace{ \maroonD{1¢}}_{\maroonD{1}{\text{ penny}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\goldE{25¢}}_{\goldE{5}{\text{ nickels}}} +\underbrace{\maroonD{1¢}}_{\maroonD{1}{\text{ penny}}}=26¢
\end{align}$

This set of coins has a value of $26¢$, so it is **not** equal to $51¢$.

###$2$ quarters and $1$ nickel

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\blueE{25¢} +\blueE{25¢}}_{\blueE{2}{\text{ quarters}}}  +\underbrace{\goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{1}{\text{ nickel}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\blueE{50¢}}_{\blueE{2}{\text{ quarters}}}  +\underbrace{\goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{1}{\text{ nickel}}}=55¢
\end{align}$

This set of coins has a value of $55¢$, so it is **not** equal to $51¢$.

###$3$ dimes, $4$ nickels, and $1$ penny

$\begin{align}
&\underbrace{\purpleD{10¢} + \purpleD{10¢} + \purpleD{10¢}}_{\purpleD{3}{\text{ dimes}}} + \underbrace{\goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢} + \goldE{5¢}}_{\goldE{4}{\text{ nickels}}} +\underbrace{ \maroonD{1¢}}_{\maroonD{1}{\text{ penny}}}\\\\
&\underbrace{\purpleD{30¢}}_{\purpleD{3}{\text{ dimes}}} + \underbrace{\goldE{20¢}}_{\goldE{4}{\text{ nickels}}} +\underbrace{\maroonD{1¢}}_{\maroonD{1}{\text{ penny}}}=51¢
\end{align}$

This set of coins has a value of $51¢$, so it **is** equal to Beth's amount of money.

Beth could have this set of coins:

$3$ dimes, $4$ nickels, and $1$ penny

question.content:
Beth has $51¢$.

**Which set of coins could Beth have?**

[[☃ radio 1]]
